title: CatAlyst: Domain-Extensible Intervention for Preventing Task Procrastination Using Large Generative Models. (arXiv:2302.05678v2 [cs.HC] UPDATED)
abstract: CatAlyst uses generative models to help workers' progress by influencing their task engagement instead of directly contributing to their task outputs. It prompts distracted workers to resume their tasks by generating a continuation of their work and presenting it as an intervention that is more context-aware than conventional (predetermined) feedback. The prompt can function by drawing their interest and lowering the hurdle for resumption even when the generated continuation is insufficient to substitute their work, while recent human-AI collaboration research aiming at work substitution depends on a stable high accuracy. This frees CatAlyst from domain-specific model-tuning and makes it applicable to various tasks. Our studies involving writing and slide-editing tasks demonstrated CatAlyst's effectiveness in helping workers swiftly resume tasks with a lowered cognitive load. ret.translated_title: CatAlyst:使用大型生成模型的面向领域可扩展干预措施防止任务拖延
ret.translated_abstract: CatAlyst使用生成模型来帮助工作者通过影响其任务参与度来推动工作者进展，而不是直接促进其任务产出。它通过生成任务的延续并将其作为干预呈现出来，以更加关注上下文。即使生成的延续不足以替代他们的工作，该提示也可以通过吸引他们的兴趣并降低恢复的障碍来发挥作用，而最近的人工智能合作研究旨在工作替换依赖于稳定的高精度。这使得CatAlyst摆脱了领域特定模型调整并使其适用于各种任务。我们的写作和幻灯片编辑任务研究证明了CatAlyst在帮助工作者迅速恢复任务并降低认知负荷方面的有效性。结果表明了一种新的人工智能合作形式，其中大型生成模型公开可用，但不涉及任务替代。
ret.tldr: CatAlyst使用生成模型帮助工作者恢复任务，通过生成任务的延续并将其作为干预呈现出来。该提示可以吸引他们的兴趣并降低恢复的障碍，而不需要高精度。CatAlyst摆脱了领域特定模型调整并适用于各种任务。
